story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful country of Kenya, there was a small village nestled at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro. In this village lived a young girl named Nia, who was known for her curiosity and kind heart.

Nia's favorite time of day was early in the morning when she would wake up before the sun rose and take her beloved donkey, Kofi, out to the fields to graze. She loved the peace and quiet of the morning, the gentle rustling of the grass as Kofi munched on it, and the way the sky slowly changed colors as the sun began to rise.

One morning, as Nia and Kofi were making their way to the fields, they came across a small, injured bird. Nia could see that the bird had a broken wing and knew that it would not be able to fly. She carefully scooped up the bird and cradled it in her hands.

Nia knew that she had to help the bird, so she decided to bring it home and take care of it. She made a comfortable nest for the bird in a small basket and fed it milk and seeds. As the days went by, the bird began to heal and grow stronger.

Nia named the bird Kikuyu, after the beautiful flowers that grew in the fields. She and Kikuyu became fast friends, and Nia loved spending time with her new feathered companion.

One day, as Nia and Kikuyu were sitting in the courtyard, they heard a loud commotion coming from the village. Nia ran to see what was happening and was shocked to see a group of men with machetes and spears, threatening the villagers.

Nia knew that she had to do something to protect her village, so she ran back to the courtyard and grabbed Kikuyu. She climbed onto Kofi's back and held Kikuyu close to her chest.

With Kikuyu perched on her shoulder, Nia charged towards the men, yelling and waving her arms. The men were taken aback by Nia's bravery and the sight of the fierce bird on her shoulder. They quickly turned and ran, leaving the village in peace.

From that day on, Nia was hailed as a hero. The villagers knew that she was brave and kind, and they all loved and respected her. And as for Kikuyu, she continued to grow stronger and more beautiful, and she and Nia remained the best of friends.

And so, the story of Nia, Kofi, and Kikuyu became a legend in the village, passed down from generation to generation. And every time Nia's daughter heard the story, she would look at her own pet bird and think of her brave and kind mother.

The end.

Good night my dear, may you have sweet dreams and always be as brave and kind as Nia.
